CurrencyRef.description:
Reference to the currency in which all amounts on the associated transaction are expressed. This must be defined if multicurrency is enabled for the company.
Multicurrency is enabled for the company if Preferences.MultiCurrencyEnabled is set to true. Read more about multicurrency support here. Required if multicurrency is enabled for the company

APAccountRef.description:
Specifies which AP account to which the bill is credited. Many/most small businesses have a single AP account, so the account can be implied. When specified, the account must be a Liability account, and further, the sub-type must be of type Payables.
We strongly recommend that the AP Account be explicitly specified in all cases as companies that have more then one AP account will encounter unexpected errors when relating transactions to each other.

VendorRef.description: The vendor reference for this transaction.

Line [0..n].description: Individual line items of a transaction. Valid Line types include: Item line. Note: The ItemRef in the ItemBasedExpenseLine below must reference an Item in QBO that has an expense account linked to it (e.g. in the ExpenseAccountRef field of the Item). Otherwise the request fails in QBO with a 'You must select an account for this transaction.' error.

Row [0..n].description:
Represents a row in a report. A group of rows is enclosed in a Rows container. Rows may be nested either as a single row or in sets, based on the accounts represented in the report and query parameters specified in the request. Parameters:
  • type—As an enclosing section of sub-rows, this is always the string, Section. As a leaf row, this is always the string, Data.
  • group—The group name, valid when type=Section. Possible values include: Income, COGS, GrossProfit, Expenses, NetOperatingIncome, OtherIncome, OtherExpenses, NetOtherIncome, NetIncome

Code.description: A three letter string representing the ISO 4217 code for the currency. For example, USD, AUD, EUR, and so on.

LineNum.description: Specifies the position of the line in the collection of transaction lines. Positive integer

Amount.description: The amount of the line item.

Description.description: Free form text description of the line item that appears in the printed record.

DetailType.description: Set to ItemReceiptLineDetailfor this type of line.

Id.description:
The Id of the line item. Its use in requests is as folllows:
  • If Idis greater than zero and exists for the company, the request is considered an update operation for a line item.
  • If no Idis provided, the Idprovided is less than or equal to zero, or the Idprovided is greater than zero and does not exist for the company then the request is considered a create operation for a line item.
    • Available in all objects that use lines and support the update operation.

Line.description:
The minimum line item required for the request is one of the following.
Sales item line type
Group item line type

CustomerRef.description: Reference to a customer or job. Query the Customer name list resource to determine the appropriate Customer object for this reference. Use Customer.Id and Customer.DisplayName from that object for CustomerRef.value and CustomerRef.name, respectively.

CurrencyRef.description:
Reference to the currency in which all amounts on the associated transaction are expressed. This must be defined if multicurrency is enabled for the company.
Multicurrency is enabled for the company if Preferences.MultiCurrencyEnabled is set to true. Read more about multicurrency support here. Required if multicurrency is enabled for the company

POCustomField-String.description: Defines field label names for custom fields that have been enabled. They need to be both enabled and defined in order for them to be available in purchase orders.

POCustomField-Boolean.description: Toggles whether Sales Forms Custom Fields are enabled on the sales form. Sales forms can have up to three custom fields.

DefaultMarkup.description: Default markup rate used to calculate the markup amount on the transactions. To enter a markup rate of 8.5%, enter 8.5, not 0.085.

IncludeOnSend.description: Used when EntityRef.type references a transaction object. This field indicates whether or not the attachment is sent with the transaction when Save and Send button is clicked in the QuickBooks UI or when the Send endpoint (send email) is invoked for the object.

LineInfo.description: For transaction objects, used to reference a transaction detail line.

NoRefOnly.description: Indicates whether or not to find attachable records that have no references to any entity. Combine with AttachableRef.Inactiveto return hidden references.

CustomField[0..n].description: If the user tries to fetch a record without permission, the permission denied message is conveyed through this field.

Inactive.description: Indicates whether or not to include references to hidden entities when filtering. When set to true , hidden references are returned in the result set. For filtering results, it works with AttachableRef.EntityRef.Type , AttachableRef.EntityRef.Value and AttachableRef.NoRefOnly filters in combination.

EntityRef.description:
Object reference to which this attachment is linked.
  • Set EntityRef.value with the Id of the target object as returned in its response body when queried.
  • Set EntityRef.type with the specific type of the target object. For example, invoice, bill, item, etc.

SyncToken.description: Version number of the object. It is used to lock an object for use by one app at a time. As soon as an application modifies an object, its SyncToken is incremented. Attempts to modify an object specifying an older SyncToken fails. Only the latest version of the object is maintained by QuickBooks Online.

AccountingInfoPrefs.description: The following settings are available for QuickBooks Online Plus editions, only. To determine this edition type, query the value of the OfferingSku CustomerInfo.Name name/value pair for QuickBooks Online Plus.

OtherPrefs.description: Specifies extension of Preference resource to allow extension of Name-Value pair based extension at the top level.

Unique identifier for this object.
Sort order is ASC by default.

MetaData.description: Descriptive information about the object. The MetaData values are set by Data Services and are read only for all applications.

MarkkupAccountRef.description: The account associated with the markup. Available with invoice objects, only, and when linktxn specified a ReimburseCharge.

PriceLevelRef.description: Reference to a PriceLevel for the markup. Support for this element will be available in the coming months.

Percent.description: Markup amount expressed as a percent of charges already entered in the current transaction. To enter a rate of 10% use 10.0, not 0.01.

Amount.description: The amount of the line item.

LinkedTxn [0..n].description: Transaction to which the current entity is related. For example, a billpayment line links to the originating bill object for which the billpayment is applied.

  • If no Idis provided, the Idprovided is less than or equal to zero, or the Idprovided is greater than zero and does not exist for the company then the request is considered a create operation for a line item.
